text.p: Turkish Airlines said its current Boeing 727-200F service between Maastricht and Istanbul will be unaffected by its new Istanbul-Paris 727F feeder service to be launched later this week in partnership with Air France.

"We operate an average of three flights per week into Maastricht and this service will be maintained, as the airport is an important distribution hub for European freight," Turkish Airlines' manager France, Bulent Demirci, told Reuters.
The Istanbul-Paris feeder service will operate three weekly frequencies initially rising to five weekly during the winter season, which begins at end-October.
The 727-200Fs, which are part of Turkish' fleet, have a freight capacity of approximately 20 tonnes.

The main traffic (around 60 percent) carried on the flights will be Turkish-manufactured textiles, destined for the U.S. market and forwaded Air France AIRF.P 747-200F freighters from Paris, an Air France Cargo official said. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 8982 Fax +44 171 542 5017
